name.description: The name of the PostgreSQL service instance

cpus.description: CPU shares to allocate to each PostgreSQL node.

mem.description: Memory to allocate to each PostgreSQL node.

dbname.description: Name for the default database that is created when the image is first started.

initdbargs.description: Arguments to send to postgres initdb. The value is a space separated string of arguments as postgres initdb would expect them.

persistence.description: Enable or disable data persistence. If enabled, requires configuration of a valid host_volume.

host_volume.description: The location of a volume on the host to be used for persisting PostgreSQL data. The final location will be derived from this value plus the name set in `name` (e.g. `/mnt/host_volume/postgresql`). This can be a mounted NFS drive. Note that this path must be the same on all DCOS agents.

volume_size.description: If a new volume is to be created, this controls its size in MBs. Defaults to 64MBs

port.description: Port number to be used for clear communication

create_vip.description: Enable or disable creating a VIP for external access through a public node running Marathon-LB. Defaults to FALSE. Please note that this connection would be UNENCRYPTED.

port_vip.description: For external access, port number to be used for clear communication in the external load balancer

virtual_host.description: For external access, Virtual Host URL to be used in the external load balancer. Modify as per your installation.
